content.description:
The question refers to the image shown.

© Peter Willi / The Bridgeman Art Library
content.question: In the lower left side of the tympanum, the church’s namesake, Saint Foy, is depicted kneeling before the outstretched hand of God in order to

choices.label: inspire visiting pilgrims to similarly adopt humble reverence before the hand of God
inform visiting pilgrims of the tragedy of her death and her resulting sainthood
remind visitors that they should approach the altar on their knees
prepare visitors that they should also expect to die as Christian martyrs

content.answer: inspire visiting pilgrims to similarly adopt humble reverence before the hand of God

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.1: Cultural Contexts of Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, content, function, and/or context of a work of art (or group of related works of art) elicit a response or shape its reception.
